Uses of Class
org.apache.sis.coverage.grid.GridDerivation

Packages that use GridDerivation
Package
Description
org.apache.sis.coverage.grid
A coverage backed by a regular grid.

  • Uses of GridDerivation in org.apache.sis.coverage.grid

    Methods in org.apache.sis.coverage.grid that return GridDerivation
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.chunkSize(int... cellCounts)
    Specifies the size of tiles or chunks in the base grid geometry.
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.clipping(GridClippingMode mode)
    Specifies whether to clip the derived grid extent to the extent of the base grid geometry.
    GridDerivation
    GridGeometry.derive()
    Returns an object that can be used for creating a new grid geometry derived from this grid geometry.
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.margin(int... cellCounts)
    Specifies an amount of cells by which to expand GridExtent after rounding.
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.maximumSubsampling(int... subsampling)
    Specifies the maximum subsampling values (inclusive) for each dimension.
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.rounding(GridRoundingMode mode)
    Controls behavior of rounding from floating point values to integers.
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.slice(DirectPosition slicePoint)
    Requests a grid geometry for a slice at the given "real world" position.
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.sliceByRatio(double sliceRatio, int... dimensionsToKeep)
    Requests a grid geometry for a slice at the given relative position.
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.subgrid(GridExtent areaOfInterest, int... subsampling)
    Requests a grid geometry over a sub-region of the base grid geometry and optionally with subsampling.
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.subgrid(GridGeometry areaOfInterest)
    Adapts the base grid for the geographic area and resolution of the given grid geometry.
    GridDerivation
    GridDerivation.subgrid(Envelope areaOfInterest, double... resolution)
    Requests a grid geometry over a sub-envelope and optionally with a coarser resolution.
